trans-unit.source: This type implements the Alloc trait by forwarding calls to the allocator registered with the #[global_allocator] attribute if there is one, or the std crate’s default.
trans-unit.target: Este tipo implementa el rasgo Alloc reenviando llamadas al asignador registrado con el #[global_allocator] atributo # [global_allocator] si lo hay, o al std por defecto del cajón.

trans-unit.source: This type implements the AllocRef trait by forwarding calls to the allocator registered with the #[global_allocator] attribute if there is one, or the std crate’s default.
This type implements the GlobalAlloc trait and Rust programs by default work as if they had this definition:
trans-unit.target: Este tipo implementa GlobalAlloc rasgo y los programas Rust por defecto funcionan como si tuvieran esta definición:

trans-unit.source: This type is broadly used across std::io for any operation which may produce an error.
trans-unit.target: Este tipo se utiliza ampliamente en std::io para cualquier operación que pueda producir un error.

trans-unit.source: This type is the error type for the from_utf16 method on String.
trans-unit.target: Este tipo es el tipo de error para el método from_utf16 en String .

trans-unit.source: This type is the error type for the from_utf8 method on String. It is designed in such a way to carefully avoid reallocations: the into_bytes method will give back the byte vector that was used in the conversion attempt.
trans-unit.target: Este tipo es el tipo de error para el método from_utf8 en String . Está diseñado de tal manera que evita cuidadosamente las reasignaciones: into_bytes método devolverá el vector de bytes que se utilizó en el intento de conversión.

trans-unit.source: This type is very similar to f32, but has increased precision by using twice as many bits. Please see the documentation for f32 or Wikipedia on double precision values for more information.

This type of lock allows a number of readers or at most one writer at any point in time. The write portion of this lock typically allows modification of the underlying data (exclusive access) and the read portion of this lock typically allows for read-only access (shared access).
trans-unit.target: Este tipo de bloqueo permite a un número de lectores o como máximo a un escritor en cualquier momento.La parte de escritura de este candado normalmente permite la modificación de los datos subyacentes (acceso exclusivo)y la parte de lectura de este candado normalmente permite el acceso de sólo lectura (acceso compartido).

trans-unit.source: This type provides methods like push and set_extension that mutate the path in place. It also implements Deref to Path, meaning that all methods on Path slices are available on PathBuf values as well.
trans-unit.target: Este tipo proporciona métodos como push y set_extension que mutan la ruta en su lugar. También implementa Deref to Path , lo que significa que todos los métodos en los segmentos de Path están disponibles en PathBuf valores de .

trans-unit.source: This type represents a borrowed reference to a nul-terminated array of bytes. It can be constructed safely from a &[u8] slice, or unsafely from a raw *const c_char. It can then be converted to a Rust &str by performing UTF-8 validation, or into an owned CString.
trans-unit.target: Este tipo representa una referencia prestada a una matriz de bytes terminada en nulo. Puede construirse de forma segura a partir de un u8 &[ u8 ] , o de forma insegura a partir de un *const c_char sin formato . Luego se puede convertir en un Rust &str realizando una validación UTF-8, o en un CString propio .

trans-unit.source: This type represents a borrowed reference to a nul-terminated array of bytes. It can be constructed safely from a &[u8] slice, or unsafely from a raw *const c_char. It can then be converted to a Rust &str by performing UTF-8 validation, or into an owned CString.
This type represents a borrowed reference to a string in the operating system's preferred representation.
trans-unit.target: Este tipo representa una referencia prestada a una cadena en la representación preferida del sistema operativo.

trans-unit.source: This type represents the status code a process can return to its parent under normal termination.
trans-unit.target: Este tipo representa el código de estado que un proceso puede devolver a su padre en una terminación normal.

trans-unit.source: This type serves the purpose of being able to safely generate a C-compatible string from a Rust byte slice or vector. An instance of this type is a static guarantee that the underlying bytes contain no interior 0 bytes ("nul characters") and that the final byte is 0 ("nul terminator").
trans-unit.target: Este tipo sirve para poder generar de forma segura una cadena compatible con C a partir de un trozo o vector de byte de óxido.Un ejemplo de este tipo es una garantía estática de que los bytes subyacentes no contienen ningún byte interior 0 ("caracteres nulos")y que el byte final es 0 ("terminador nulo").

trans-unit.source: This type supports a number of operations for inspecting a path, including breaking the path into its components (separated by / on Unix and by either / or on Windows), extracting the file name, determining whether the path is absolute, and so on.
trans-unit.target: Este tipo admite una serie de operaciones para inspeccionar una ruta, incluida la división de la ruta en sus componentes (separados por / en Unix y por / o en Windows), extraer el nombre del archivo, determinar si la ruta es absoluta, etc.

trans-unit.source: This type supports a number of operations for inspecting a path, including breaking the path into its components (separated by / on Unix and by either / or \ on Windows), extracting the file name, determining whether the path is absolute, and so on.

This type will almost always be f32, which is guaranteed to be an IEEE-754 single-precision float in Rust. That said, the standard technically only guarantees that it be a floating-point number, and it may have less precision than f32 or not follow the IEEE-754 standard at all.
trans-unit.target: Este tipo casi siempre será f32 , que se garantiza que es un flotador de precisión simple IEEE-754 en Rust. Dicho esto, el estándar técnicamente solo garantiza que sea un número de punto flotante, y puede tener menos precisión que f32 o no seguir el estándar IEEE-754 en absoluto.

trans-unit.source: This type will almost always be f64, which is guaranteed to be an IEEE-754 double-precision float in Rust. That said, the standard technically only guarantees that it be a floating-point number with at least the precision of a float, and it may be f32 or something entirely different from the IEEE-754 standard.
trans-unit.target: Este tipo casi siempre será f64 , que se garantiza que es un flotador de doble precisión IEEE-754 en Rust. Dicho esto, el estándar técnicamente solo garantiza que sea un número de punto flotante con al menos la precisión de un float , y puede ser f32 o algo completamente diferente del estándar IEEE-754.

trans-unit.source: This type will almost always be i16, but may differ on some esoteric systems. The C standard technically only requires that this type be a signed integer with at least 16 bits; some systems may define it as i32, for example.
trans-unit.target: Este tipo casi siempre será i16 , pero puede diferir en algunos sistemas esotéricos. El estándar C técnicamente solo requiere que este tipo sea un entero con signo con al menos 16 bits; algunos sistemas pueden definirlo como i32 , por ejemplo.

trans-unit.source: This type will almost always be i32, but may differ on some esoteric systems. The C standard technically only requires that this type be a signed integer that is at least the size of a short; some systems define it as an i16, for example.
trans-unit.target: Este tipo casi siempre será i32 , pero puede diferir en algunos sistemas esotéricos. El estándar C técnicamente solo requiere que este tipo sea un entero con signo que sea al menos del tamaño de un short ; algunos sistemas lo definen como un i16 , por ejemplo.

trans-unit.source: This type will almost always be i64, but may differ on some systems. The C standard technically only requires that this type be a signed integer that is at least 64 bits and at least the size of a long, although in practice, no system would have a long long that is not an i64, as most systems do not have a standardised i128 type.
trans-unit.target: Este tipo casi siempre será i64 , pero puede diferir en algunos sistemas. El estándar C técnicamente solo requiere que este tipo sea un entero con signo que tenga al menos 64 bits y al menos el tamaño de un long , aunque en la práctica ningún sistema tendría un long long que no sea un i64 , ya que la mayoría de los sistemas no lo hacen. tener un estandarizado i128 tipo .

trans-unit.source: This type will almost always be u16, but may differ on some esoteric systems. The C standard technically only requires that this type be an unsigned integer with the same size as a short.
trans-unit.target: Este tipo casi siempre será u16 , pero puede diferir en algunos sistemas esotéricos. El estándar C técnicamente solo requiere que este tipo sea un entero sin signo con el mismo tamaño que un short .

trans-unit.source: This type will almost always be u32, but may differ on some esoteric systems. The C standard technically only requires that this type be an unsigned integer with the same size as an int; some systems define it as a u16, for example.
trans-unit.target: Este tipo casi siempre será u32 , pero puede diferir en algunos sistemas esotéricos. El estándar C técnicamente solo requiere que este tipo sea un entero sin signo con el mismo tamaño que un int ; algunos sistemas lo definen como un u16 , por ejemplo.

trans-unit.source: This type will almost always be u64, but may differ on some systems. The C standard technically only requires that this type be an unsigned integer with the size of a long long, although in practice, no system would have a long long that is not a u64, as most systems do not have a standardised u128 type.
trans-unit.target: Este tipo casi siempre será u64 , pero puede diferir en algunos sistemas. El estándar C técnicamente solo requiere que este tipo sea un entero sin signo con el tamaño de un long long , aunque en la práctica, ningún sistema tendría un long long que no sea un u64 , ya que la mayoría de los sistemas no tienen un u128 estandarizado . tipo .

trans-unit.source: This type will almost always be f32, which is guaranteed to be an IEEE-754 single-precision float in Rust. That said, the standard technically only guarantees that it be a floating-point number, and it may have less precision than f32 or not follow the IEEE-754 standard at all.

This type will almost always be f64, which is guaranteed to be an IEEE-754 double-precision float in Rust. That said, the standard technically only guarantees that it be a floating-point number with at least the precision of a float, and it may be f32 or something entirely different from the IEEE-754 standard.

This type will almost always be i16, but may differ on some esoteric systems. The C standard technically only requires that this type be a signed integer with at least 16 bits; some systems may define it as i32, for example.

This type will almost always be i32, but may differ on some esoteric systems. The C standard technically only requires that this type be a signed integer that is at least the size of a short; some systems define it as an i16, for example.

This type will almost always be i64, but may differ on some systems. The C standard technically only requires that this type be a signed integer that is at least 64 bits and at least the size of a long, although in practice, no system would have a long long that is not an i64, as most systems do not have a standardised i128 type.
This type will almost always be u16, but may differ on some esoteric systems. The C standard technically only requires that this type be an unsigned integer with the same size as a short.

This type will almost always be u32, but may differ on some esoteric systems. The C standard technically only requires that this type be an unsigned integer with the same size as an int; some systems define it as a u16, for example.

This type will almost always be u64, but may differ on some systems. The C standard technically only requires that this type be an unsigned integer with the size of a long long, although in practice, no system would have a long long that is not a u64, as most systems do not have a standardised u128 type.

This type will always be i32 or i64. Most notably, many Linux-based systems assume an i64, but Windows assumes i32. The C standard technically only requires that this type be a signed integer that is at least 32 bits and at least the size of an int, although in practice, no system would have a long that is neither an i32 nor i64.
trans-unit.target: Este tipo siempre será i32 o i64 . En particular, muchos sistemas basados ​​en Linux asumen un i64 , pero Windows asume i32 . El estándar C técnicamente solo requiere que este tipo sea un entero con signo que tenga al menos 32 bits y al menos el tamaño de un int , aunque en la práctica, ningún sistema tendría un long que no sea ni i32 ni i64 .

trans-unit.source: This type will always be i8, but is included for completeness. It is defined as being a signed integer the same size as a C char.
trans-unit.target: Este tipo siempre será i8 , pero se incluye para completar. Se define como un entero con signo del mismo tamaño que un char C .

trans-unit.source: This type will always be u32 or u64. Most notably, many Linux-based systems assume an u64, but Windows assumes u32. The C standard technically only requires that this type be an unsigned integer with the size of a long, although in practice, no system would have a ulong that is neither a u32 nor u64.
trans-unit.target: Este tipo siempre será u32 o u64 . Más notablemente, muchos sistemas basados ​​en Linux asumen un u64 , pero Windows asume u32 . El estándar C técnicamente solo requiere que este tipo sea un entero sin signo con el tamaño de un long , aunque en la práctica ningún sistema tendría un ulong que no sea ni u32 ni u64 .

trans-unit.source: This type will always be u8, but is included for completeness. It is defined as being an unsigned integer the same size as a C char.
trans-unit.target: Este tipo siempre será u8 , pero se incluye para completar. Se define como un entero sin signo del mismo tamaño que un char C .

trans-unit.source: This type will always be i32 or i64. Most notably, many Linux-based systems assume an i64, but Windows assumes i32. The C standard technically only requires that this type be a signed integer that is at least 32 bits and at least the size of an int, although in practice, no system would have a long that is neither an i32 nor i64.
This type will always be i8, but is included for completeness. It is defined as being a signed integer the same size as a C char.

This type will always be u32 or u64. Most notably, many Linux-based systems assume an u64, but Windows assumes u32. The C standard technically only requires that this type be an unsigned integer with the size of a long, although in practice, no system would have a ulong that is neither a u32 nor u64.
This type will always be u8, but is included for completeness. It is defined as being an unsigned integer the same size as a C char.
This typedef is generally used to avoid writing out io::Error directly and is otherwise a direct mapping to Result.
trans-unit.target: Este typedef se usa generalmente para evitar escribir io::Error directamente y, de lo contrario, es una asignación directa a Result .

trans-unit.source: This typically means that an operation could only succeed if it read a particular number of bytes but only a smaller number of bytes could be read.
trans-unit.target: Esto significa típicamente que una operación sólo podría tener éxito si leyera un número determinado de bytes,pero sólo se podría leer un número menor de bytes.

trans-unit.source: This typically means that an operation could only succeed if it wrote a particular number of bytes but only a smaller number of bytes could be written.
trans-unit.target: Esto significa típicamente que una operación sólo podría tener éxito si escribiera un número determinado de bytes,pero sólo se podría escribir un número menor de bytes.

trans-unit.source: This usage of Option to create safe nullable pointers is so common that Rust does special optimizations to make the representation of Option<Box<T>> a single pointer. Optional pointers in Rust are stored as efficiently as any other pointer type.
trans-unit.target: Este uso de Option para crear punteros seguros que aceptan valores NULL es tan común que Rust realiza optimizaciones especiales para hacer que la representación de Option < Box<T> > sea un solo puntero. Los punteros opcionales en Rust se almacenan de manera tan eficiente como cualquier otro tipo de puntero.

trans-unit.source: This usage of extern does not require unsafe.
trans-unit.target: Este uso de extern no requiere unsafe .

This value sets the time-to-live field that is used in every packet sent from this socket.
trans-unit.target: Este valor establece el campo de tiempo de vida que se utiliza en cada paquete enviado desde este enchufe.

trans-unit.source: This variant is the most common one, it represents references to files or directories.
trans-unit.target: Esta variante es la más común,representa referencias a archivos o directorios.

trans-unit.source: This variant will be emitted when the parsing string has a value of zero, which would be illegal for non-zero types.
trans-unit.target: Esta variante se emitirá cuando la cadena de análisis tenga un valor de cero,lo que sería ilegal para los tipos que no sean cero.
